text:
Pt is a 59yo male w/ Hx of renal failure on HD, DM II, and seizure
   disorder. Lives in assisted housing. Reportedly failed to report to HD
   tx on [**8-23**]. Staff at living facility entered apartment and found him on
   the floor confused & disoriented. EMS called, blood sugar 24- given
   2amps of D50 tnsf to [**Hospital1 54**]. In EW sugar 148. Since missed HD pts K+
   6.4, hypertensive/ tachycardic, also temp spiked to 102. BC x2 sent,
   Received HD then tnsf to [**Hospital Ward Name 790**] 3. On floor pt c/o severe back pain. CT
   scan of head, neck & back done w/ mult abcesses seen in lungs. BC grew
   GPC in [**1-27**] bottles, this w/ back pain concerning for epidural abscess.
   Has L SC dialysis line that
s prob source of infection. Tnsf to CCU for
   mngmt. Plan is for MRI w/ contrast then two full HD tx to remove
   contrast, using his current HD line. ? Surgery involvement to remove
   tunneled line.
   Sepsis without organ dysfunction
   Assessment:
   Pt w/ GPC in [**1-27**] blood cultures. Mult abscesses seen in lungs on CT,
   chronic back pain concerning for epidural abscess. Has hx of HD line
   staph infections & now prob new HD line infection. Tmax 99.8po, wbc
   17.8
   Action:
   Neurology not concerned for epidural abscess; cancelled order for MRI.
   Considering lumbar puncture to assess for meningitis/
   meningoencephalitis or albuminocytological dissociation if imaging to
   evaluate for epidural abscess is negative. Is ordered for zosyn &
   vancomycin w/ HD to cover for potential meningitis. No additional BC
   sent.
   Response:
   Given 250cc bolus for BPs in low 80s w/ good response. Has had no Vanco
   (w/ HD) for 48 hrs.
   Plan:
   Vanco trough & Lactate sent. Monitor for temp spikes. Pain management
   prior to moving pt.
   Renal failure, End stage (End stage renal disease, ESRD)
   Assessment:
   Pt is HD dependent, last HD [**8-24**].  Repeat K+ 5.7 post kayexulate, Cre
   15.7, BUN 116.
   Action:
   Renal attending/ fellows attempt at a temporary dialysis line in L fem
   vein was unsuccessful. Notified IR for line placement. Transplant
   surgery consulted to pull infected HD line.
   Response:
   IR unable to place new dialysis line until tomorrow. Transplant surgery
   to pull current HD line prior to this in CCU.
   Plan:
   NPO, make sure pt fully awake when giving meds w/ thickend liquids,
   ?evening labs.
